elements.description:
** Anypoint version of the component **

This element is to be private and used as a replacemenet to any PolymerElements

`<paper-checkbox>` is a button that can be either checked or unchecked.
User can tap the checkbox to check or uncheck it.  Usually you use checkboxes
to allow user to select multiple options from a set.
Avoid using a single checkbox as an option selector and use toggle button intead.

### Example

```html
<paper-checkbox>label</paper-checkbox>
<paper-checkbox checked>label</paper-checkbox>
```

### Styling

`<anypoint-checkbox>` provides the following custom properties and mixins for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--paper-checkbox` | Mixin applied to the element | `{}`
`--paper-checkbox-input-border-bolor` | Border color of the checkbox input square | `--anypoint-color-aluminum4`
`--paper-checkbox-label-color` | A color of the label. | ` --anypoint-color-steel1`
`--paper-checkbox-label` | Mixin applied to the label | ``
`--paper-checkbox-label-checked-color` | Color of checked label | `--anypoint-checkbox-label-color` or `--anypoint-color-steel1`
`--paper-checkbox-label-checked` | Mixin applie dto checked label | ``
`--paper-checkbox-unchecked-color` | Color of a label of unchecked checkbox | `--anypoint-checkbox-label-color` or `--anypoint-color-steel1`
`--paper-checkbox-error-color` | Color of error state | `--anypoint-color-danger`
`--paper-checkbox-label-spacing` | Spacing between the label and the checkbox | `0`

properties.name: hovered
properties.description: Set to `true` when the control is currently being hovered.

properties.name: keyEventTarget
properties.description:
The EventTarget that will be firing relevant KeyboardEvents. Set it to
`null` to disable the listeners.

properties.name: stopKeyboardEventPropagation
properties.description:
If true, this property will cause the implementing element to
automatically stop propagation on any handled KeyboardEvents.

properties.name: _imperativeKeyBindings
properties.description: own properties of everything on the "prototype".

properties.name: pressed
properties.description: If true, the user is currently holding down the button.

properties.name: toggles
properties.description:
If true, the button toggles the active state with each tap or press
of the spacebar.

properties.name: active
properties.description: If true, the button is a toggle and is currently in the active state.

properties.name: pointerDown
properties.description:
True if the element is currently being pressed by a "pointer," which
is loosely defined as mouse or touch input (but specifically excluding
keyboard input).

properties.name: receivedFocusFromKeyboard
properties.description:
True if the input device that caused the element to receive focus
was a keyboard.

properties.name: focused
properties.description: If true, the element currently has focus.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: If true, the user cannot interact with this element.

properties.name: _oldTabIndex
properties.description:
Value of the `tabindex` attribute before `disabled` was activated.
`null` means the attribute was not present.

properties.name: required
properties.description:
Set to true to mark the input as required. If used in a form, a
custom element that uses this behavior should also use
Polymer.IronValidatableBehavior and define a custom validation method.
Otherwise, a `required` element will always be considered valid.
It's also strongly recommended to provide a visual style for the element
when its value is invalid.

properties.name: _parentForm
properties.description: The form that the element is registered to.

properties.name: validator
properties.description: Name of the validator to use.

properties.name: invalid
properties.description: True if the last call to `validate` is invalid.

properties.name: checked
properties.description: Gets or sets the state, `true` is checked and `false` is unchecked.

methods.name: _hoverCallback
methods.description: Set's the `hovered` attribute to true when handled.

methods.name: _leaveCallback
methods.description: Updates `hovered` if the control is not hovered anymore.

methods.name: addOwnKeyBinding
methods.description:
Can be used to imperatively add a key binding to the implementing
element. This is the imperative equivalent of declaring a keybinding
in the `keyBindings` prototype property.

methods.name: removeOwnKeyBindings
methods.description: When called, will remove all imperatively-added key bindings.

methods.name: keyboardEventMatchesKeys
methods.description: Returns true if a keyboard event matches `eventString`.

methods.name: _asyncClick
methods.description: event handler to unwind before triggering another event

methods.name: _validator
methods.description:
Recompute this every time it's needed, because we don't know if the
underlying IronValidatableBehaviorMeta has changed.

methods.name: validate

params.name: value
params.description:
Deprecated: The value to be validated. By default,
it is passed to the validator's `validate()` function, if a validator is set.
If this argument is not specified, then the element's `value` property
is used, if it exists.

methods.name: _getValidity
methods.description: Returns false if the element is required and not checked, and true otherwise.

return.desc: true if `required` is false or if `checked` is true.

methods.name: _requiredChanged
methods.description: Update the aria-required label when `required` is changed.

methods.name: _checkedChanged
methods.description: Fire `iron-changed` when the checked state changes.

methods.name: _valueChanged
methods.description: Reset value to 'on' if it is set to `undefined`.

elements.name: AnypointElements.PaperCheckbox
